inn1.comm: 119 kph, begins with a slower ball which goes across the batsman as Lahiru leaves it well alone
126 kph, brings up the length, and the pace somewhat as this is defended away to the off side
114 kph, slips in another slower one, a tad wider of the batsman this time, as this is left alone
123 kph, defended away with a slightly angled face off the back foot to this length ball going across him
123 kph, sensibly withdraws the bat to this length ball bowled on a wider line than the delivery before
118 kph, good, tight start from Mills as he delivers this on just a back of a length, with the ball defended away to the off side as it went across the batsman
129 kph, goes down the leg-side first up as Dilshan fails to get bat on this as he looks to flick it away. Ball ends up brushing the pads on the way to Ronchi
134 kph, length ball which nips in from just outside off as this is blunted away to the leg side
133 kph, delivers a beauty next up in the corridor of uncertainty which jags away at the last moment as Dilshan presses forward to defend. Too good for Dilly there
130 kph, first runs off the day for Sri Lanka with this clip through backward square leg by Dilshan
135 kph, too full and straight as this is clipped away neatly through midwicket, with the long chase by the fielder ending up fruitlessly as the ball reaches the rope despite the dive
134 kph, plants his foot before slogging rather haphazardly across the line to this length ball which seams in from outside off
123 kph, looking to square-drive this fuller length going across him away but doesn't quite middle it
126 kph, this time targeting the pads of Lahiru is this is clipped through midwicket for a brace
126 kph, defended on the front foot to this length ball which pitches on and about off
126 kph, gets away with a chop-on to this length ball going across him as the ball streaks away behind through backward square
128 kph, leans forward to this length ball outside off as this is turned away softly to the leg side
122 kph, gets this wrong totally as he slips one down leg, with the umpire swiveling around to signal the scorer
125 kph, able to glance away a single off the back foot through square leg to retain the strike
gets solidly behind the line of this just back of a length outside his off stump
135 kph, pushes at this length ball outside off as the fielder on the off side picks it up
135 kph, eases away this back of a length on the pads through backward square leg for one
136 kph, is well early on this back of a length on leg stump as the ball is miscued away to the off side off the leading edge as he looked for the glance
138 kph, looking to pick the gap through midwicket on the leg side, but finds the close-in fielder
128 kph, manages to square up Lahiru with this length on middle and leg as the ball catches the outside edge to run away safely to the fielder at third man
125 kph, gets well forward to defend this fuller length going across him

128 kph, definite sound as Lahiru had a waft at this short of a length going across him, with Ronchi completing the catch. There is interest among the slips and close-in fielders, but not enough excitement for them to prompt a review. And it looks like there may have been something there as there is a definite sound off the bottom of the bat as it went through
128 kph, able to get up and under this fuller ball which is pitched wide of off, as this is sliced high over backward point
127 kph, defended away with a slightly angled face by Lahiru

124 kph, pushes at this length ball slanting across him as the pace is quite not there for this to be forced through, with the ball in the air temporarily before dying on its way to the mid-off fielder
124 kph, delivers this length ball on the pads as they tuck it away for a rather straightforward signal through the leg side
132 kph, defends this back of a length through the off side
130 kph, on the pads as this is flicked away straight to the fielder at square leg
135 kph, opens the face to run this length ball outside off through third man
138 kph, straying down the leg side as Dilshan fails to get this away with a glance
133 kph, gets nicely on top of this short of a length on middle and off as this is hooked through to deep fine leg
137 kph, rocks forward to squirt away this fuller one going across to the man at point
131 kph, begins with a length ball going across the right-hander as Dilshan defends to the leg side
133 kph, is late on this length ball which strikes just above the front leg pad, as the ball ricochets to the off side
136 kph, is fortunate to get an inside-edge to this length ball shaping in from middle and leg as he brought down the bat
132 kph, far too early into the pull now as he looks to swipe McClenaghan across the line through midwicket

131 kph, shifts the line a bit more to the leg side as this time Dilshan finds the space to glance this away before setting off for a quick single, with Lahiru running to the danger end as Grant Elliott, at midwicket, runs back and to his right to pickup and fire in a throw at the striker's end, which is well wide of the stumps
132 kph, good, steady start from Mitch as this length ball is defended away to the off side
134 kph, tucks away this slightly back of a length ball through the leg side, but not far enough to pickup the single
134 kph, length outside off and Dilshan uncorks a trademark drive on the up through cover, with the ball racing away as it picked up momentum off the surface
136 kph, is a touch late on this leg-side straying delivery from Southee, as he fails to get away the flick through backward square

137 kph, looking to get Dilshan to hole out to deep fine leg with the hook as the batsman fails to get this shorter one away properly, with the ball landing with a couple of bounces before said fielder
132 kph, able to glide this length ball going across him to the fielder stationed at third man

102 kph, finishes off with the slower ball which is played away with soft hands through the off side before the pair scampered a quick single, which they complete successfully despite a throw fired in from the close-in fielder to the non-striker's
135 kph, driven firmly on the up, but straight to the man at mid-off
138 kph, picked this one up beautifully as he flicks Mitch effortlessly through backward square to find the boundary on one bounce. Looked a lot more fluent here as he executed the stroke
135 kph, this time looks to open the face to steer this length ball outside his off stump past gully

139 kph, cranking it up now is Mitch as this length ball shaping in is defended back to him, with the bowler falling down in his followthrough as he endeavoured to field the ball, before flicking the ball underhand at the non-striker's when he sees the batsman backing up
135 kph, gets this one to nibble away a touch as Dilshan rocked forward to ease this through midwicket, with the ball ending up edged away through the off side
130 kph, short outside off which just sits up for Lahiru as he is able to get into position quickly to hook this one high over square leg before finding the boundary with a couple of bounces
128 kph, able to pickup a single with a dab to the leg side
131 kph, defended away by the batsman
132 kph, plays down the wrong line to this length ball going across him as Ronchi collects from behind

130 kph, plays a similar stroke to the delivery before, except this time he offers up a thick outside edge which falls low to Taylor's right at slip, who fails to grasp it as it continues behind to the boundary
138 kph, back of a length outside off which rises high as this is collected behind by Ronchi
134 kph, gets nicely behind the line of this back of a length on middle and leg as the ball falls softly to the leg side
133 kph, squares up Dilshan a touch as he fails to get this leg-side delivery away, with the ball getting a leading edge through the off side instead as they ran a couple
134 kph, on the pads now as this is glanced behind to fine leg
134 kph, gets into position quickly to employ his back foot defense to this length ball going across him
135 kph, glances this one away off the hips through fine leg to find the single

133 kph, length on middle and leg which is defended softly to the leg side, with the non-striker backing up quite a bit before heading back to his end when he sees the close-in fielder on the leg side pick up the ball and line up for a shy at his end
135 kph, driven solidly off the back foot to the man at mid off
tosses up one on middle and leg which is worked away fine through fine leg
gets down the track to work this one pitched up on middle and leg down to long on. Brings up the 50-run stand between these two
tries to cut this one off the back foot past the slip, but the fielder puts in a fine, diving stop
defended from the crease to the off side
waits on the back foot before crashing this away through the covers
able to steer one down to the mid-on fielder as they run a tight, single, which they complete safely

132 kph, and he is greeted to the crease by a well-placed slap off the back foot through the covers to find the boundary. Was a loosener from Anderson which was treated with disdain by the stand-in SL captain
129 kph, this time worked away off the pads down to deep square leg for a brace
133 kph, gets forward before pushing at this fuller length ball outside his off stump square off the wicket
128 kph, steers this one straight to the man at mid-off
goes round the wicket to Dilshan as the batsman is late on this back of a length ball outside his off stump as he looked to run it away through third man
118 kph, length delivery, wide of off, which is slapped away to the fielder at backward point, who puts in a good stop
dances down the track before guiding this one straight to the mid-on fielder

slightly short as Dilshan gets back to try and pull this aerially through midwicket, but ends up top-edging high to cow corner, with the fielder unable to get close to the ball as it landed on the ground
whisked away for a single down the leg side
steered expertly on the full through the off side for one
driven away through the off side, but finds the close-in fielder
rocks back before cutting this away through to deep cover
119 kph, continues round the wicket as Dilshan slams this fuller one angling in over extra-cover, but not enough for this to get to the boundary rope as the ball is tracked back by the fielder
118 kph, glides this length ball outside off through the backward point region to give Lahiru the strike
119 kph, reaches out to this fuller one pitched outside off as the ball is squirted away to the fielder at deep backward point
116 kph, full, outside off, and driven on the up through the covers, but is stopped by the fielder at the ring

131 kph, attempts a drop-single as he played with soft hands at this length ball shaping in from outside off. Goes round the pitch initially before seeing the slip fielder run in hard and fire in a throw
133 kph, Lahiru is struck on front by this inswinging delivery from Anderson, and looks dead plumb. Doesn't even bother to review it as Dilshan agrees rather grimly..
goes down the track to steer Vettori through mid-on
slightly shorter as Dilshan gets back in his crease before clipping this away through backward square
turns away this flighted delivery on and around middle through to the leg side
gets down the pitch before pushing this one down to long on
carted away off the back foot by Dilshan as he picks up the gap through cow corner to get four runs. Safe shot with only one man in the deep on the leg side
this time nurdles a single off the back foot through cover to keep the strike
123 kph, continues round the wicket to Dilshan as he gets this one well wide outside off
131 kph, whips away this fuller delivery angling in as deep square-leg comes into play
131 kph, length on middle and leg which is tucked away through the leg side
119 kph, tries to clobber one away through the off side on the front foot before edging this one behind to the fielder at third man
124 kph, pushes at this fuller one as Anderson sticks out a mitt to field the ball in his follow through
132 kph, in the zone as Sangakkara bends one knee to cover-drive this crisply on the up to find the deep extra-cover boundary
119 kph, this time looks to open the face to glide it past the slips, but is unsuccessful
defended back to the bowler by Dilshan
tries to force this away on the back foot, but finds the cover fielder
once again onto the back foot to this slider as Dilshan picks his gap on the off side to pickup a single
Sangakkara reaches out before steering this one straight to long off
waits on it before nudging it away through the leg side for a single
punched away off the back in front of square to end the over
133 kph, length ball going across as this is struck firmly to the fielder at mid-off
131 kph, drives this length ball on the up to the fielder at mid-off before setting off for a quick single
128 kph, struck firmly to the off side, but straight to the close-in fielder
133 kph, gets a chop-on to this just back of a length delivery which streaks away just behind square on the leg side

132 kph, goes for the tap-and-single just outside his off stump to this length ball as he plays close to the body before setting off immediately for the other end, putting in a despairing dive as he grounded his bat. Looks like he may have hurt himself in the process of doing that as he is attended to by the physio. The single brings up his fifty as well
130 kph, picks up one run with a glide down to third man
struck straight back at the bowler in his follow through
short enough for Sangakkars to swivel and pull through midwicket, but not where he would have liked it as he locates the fielder in the deep
advances down before steering this straight to long off
struck away off the back foot towards the vicinity of cow corner
gets plenty behind this lofted sweep through midwicket as he brings up the Sri Lankan 100
this time hangs on the back foot before cutting this away powerfully through backward point to pinpoint the gap, and more importantly for the visitors, the boundary
129 kph, almost succeeds in playing this length ball outside off onto his stumps, but gets hit on the pad instead
133 kph, able to glide away this length delivery wide of off through third man
139 kph, meets this length ball with the full face as the initial bounce off the pitch gets the ball high over the bowler before the mid-on fielder runs round to his left to field the ball

132 kph, into position beautifully as he unfurls a drive on the up through the covers, but not enough for this to find the boundary as it is eventually cut off. Certainly deserved more from that one as he executed it sublimely
122 kph, needled away off the back foot in front of square to end the over
begins with a length delivery outside off which is redirected by Dilshan through to long on
goes round the wicket now to the left-hander as Sangakkara drills this fuller one straight to the cover fielder
this time steered away on the front foot through midwicket, with the pair completing a single
clipped away efficiently by Dilshan through backward square as he runs the first one very hard in order to return for the second in time before the throw
tucked away softly off the back foot to the leg side
waits on it before pushing this one past the mid-on fielder to find long on, and a single
120 kph, almost yorker-length delivery on and around leg which is clipped away square off the wicket on the leg side
132 kph, gets far too early into this pull shot, as he intended to blast this through midwicket, but ends up getting struck on the chest as a consequence
116 kph, this time in better position to attack this high full toss which seems to go above waist-height, but is not penalised by the umpire. Ends up at deep midwicket
gets solidly behind the line of this length ball outside off
136 kph, fuller one outside off which is poked at by Sangakkara as he finds the cover fielder, who is able to fire in a throw at the non-striker's but soon after the batsman had grounded his bat
131 kph, steps over a touch to the off side before defending with an angled bat
going round the wicket to Sangakkara as he gets this delivery to slant down the leg side, which Kumar sees early as he waits before paddling this to find the deep fine leg boundary
pushes at this length ball going across him as the silly mid-on fielder puts in a dive to cut it off
struck firmly to the man at short mid-off by Sangakkara
waits on it before tucking it away through the leg side
another leg-side delivery, with a bit more pace for Sangakkara to use, as he paddles this with some impetus through the same area, finding the rope in a hurry
reaches out before re-directing this length delivery outside his off stump through to long on
120 kph, pushes at this length ball going across him as he finds the close-in fielder on the off side
123 kph, gets this one to nip in a touch as Sangakkara played down the wrong line in an attempt to hit more towards extra-cover/long off
127 kph, fuller one now across the same line which is struck firmly at mid-off
125 kph, slight inside-edge onto the pads as he looked to push at this length ball going across him
126 kph, fuller one which is directed towards the fielder at long off
125 kph, intentionally edges away this back of a length outside his off stump down to third man
helped down to the man at long on by Dilshan
pushes at this length ball going down the leg side to the fielder at long on
struck sweetly to the leg side, but right to mid-on
fuller one which lands just past Dilshan's blade as he looked to paddle-sweep this
helped away off the pads as this is played to the leg side
waits on it before executing the drop single to perfection just outside his off stump
turned away to the leg side to end the over
125 kph, advances down the track before slogging this length delivery from Mills through cow corner to get away a perfectly-calculated boundary
123 kph, simply opens the face this time to run this down to third man for a single
128 kph, shorter one which has Dilshan rocking onto the back foot as he pulls this to deep midwicket
128 kph, Sangakkars looking to ratchet up the gears as he locates the boundary between deep fine leg and deep backward square to pickup a boundary as he threads the gap with ease
127 kph, shorter one which Sangakkars just about gets away with a rather rash hook through the leg side
127 kph, short and slanting down leg as Mills is helped away through deep fine leg with a pull
full length delivery which is eased down to long on by Dilshan
struck sweetly, but straight to the man at mid-off
steered away to deep extra-cover this time by the batsman

slipping down the leg side as Dilshan overbalances as he looked to flick this behind square, but doesn't make any contact as Ronchi picks up the ball down the leg side before flicking the bails in one fluid motion, in an attempt to beat planted Dilshan's foot in case it hovered in the air temporarily. Dilshan's foot was up in the air initially before he put it back down in time before the bails were removed by Ronchi
onto the back foot as he pulls powerfully through midwicket for a single
tucked away off the back foot to the leg side
pushes at this length ball going across him to the man at long on
starts round the wicket to Sangakkara as this is defended back off the back foot
drives this one firmly on the up down to long off
tries to get away this tossed up delivery past Kane, but finds the bowler
uses his feet well to guide this through long off to get off strike
shimmies down the track before reaching out to dead-bat this back towards the bowler
hangs on the back foot before cutting away powerfully through the covers
tickles the spinner just behind square on the leg side to get away from the strike
is well late on this one spinning onto the pads on leg
goes down the track before employing his front foot defence as he crouched low
punched away off the back foot, but straight to silly mid-off
brings the bat down to re-direct this through midwicket, but not far enough to pickup the single
again hangs on the back foot before working this away to cow corner
tucked away off the pads to the square-leg fielder. Moves into the 80s now
flighted just outside off as Sangakkara gets down on one-knee before sweeping this one hard to the cow corner rope
gets a touch early on this sweep as he looked to target the same area, but instead gets it squarer away through the leg side
cut away off the back foot, but point makes an excellent diving stop
goes down the track before drilling this one straight to long off
helped away outside off to the region of extra-cover

of course as soon as I have said that Sangakkara has pretty much gone and paddled this leg-side delivery from Kane past the leg slip to find the boundary. Also earns him his 94th ODI half-century, making him just two behind the Little Master to tie the record
this time executes the lofted sweepshot through midwicket, with the ball beating Anderson on the boundary to the rope
manages to nurdle a single on the off side to get Dilshan on strike
defended from the crease by the right-hander
punched away off the back foot just in front of square
waits before easing this one on the front foot straight to the mid-on fielder
130 kph, begins with a length delivery going across the batsman as this is pushed straight to the cover fielder
132 kph, gets early into his pull shot as he looked to connect with this in an attempt to find the square-leg boundary

133 kph, Sangakkara lasers this fuller one going across to Guptill at point. Goes down the track before realising his partner is not interested in the run, which leaves him stranded in no-mans land, with Guptill at point given some time by Sangakkara to compose himself and fire in a throw, but fails to do so as he rattles it off instinctively, with the end result being a miss at Sanga's end. Would have been a big blow had Guptill found his mark
manages to get away a single through to fine leg to get off strike

and Dilshan's innings comes to an unlikely end as he offers up an edge outside off to Ronchi, who completes the take gleefully to make Sri Lanka two down. Good innings from the right-handed opener as he looked set for what would have been his third century of the series
139 kph, gets underway with a clip off the pads to this fuller one going down leg
looks like he has had his sighter as he proceeds to clobber Vettori first-ball high over cow corner to get a one-bounce four
this time tries to force one past Vettori on the front foot, with the spinner unable to grasp the ball in his follow through as he collapsed on top of it
reaches out before nurdling this one away to long on
waits on it before cutting it away behind square, but straight to backward point
drifts down the leg side as Mahela plays down the wrong line. Signaled wide by the umpire
onto the back foot as this is cut away efficiently to deep cover
tucked away neatly by Sangakkara to the leg side to retain the strike
133 kph, short on leg stump as this is hooked fine with a swivel to deep fine leg
135 kph, gets nicely on top of the bounce of this back of a length on middle and off
135 kph, not quite enough room for the cut there as he is cramped for space, which is ultimately reflected in how disparagingly far the ball gets away off the square
133 kph, once again looks to cut it away off the back foot, but the line is not quite on for the stroke
133 kph, gets this one to shape in from just back of a length as this is deflected away to the leg side by Mahela
132 kph, short one which Sangakkara is quickly into position to pull as he gets this away to deep square-leg
131 kph, begins with a length ball which is defended to the off side by Sangakkara
133 kph, able to ride this just back of a length outside his off stump as this is fended away to the off side for a quick single
134 kph, full delivery, outside off, which is squirted away by Mahela as he opened the face, looking to slice this through point, but finds the fielder
132 kph, going down leg and Sangakkara helps himself to another boundary through fine leg as he tickles this away
123 kph, was looking to dab this one outside his off stump through to third man, but is late on it as he brought the bat down
132 kph, in the slot for Sangakkara to uncork his trademark bended-knee cover drive, but ends up getting it away squarer towards deep cover
130 kph, far too short from Southee on leg stump as the square-leg umpire confirms the call
136 kph, glanced away off the hips towards deep backward square
131 kph, able to locate the gap to the right of third man as he cuts away late to pinpoint the boundary
once again flirts with the ball outside his off stump as this is slapped away to point
134 kph, hangs on the back foot before running this down to a squarish third man
134 kph, short of a length on leg which is helped off the pads through backward square

135 kph, and Southee is rewarded for persisting in that fourth/fifth stump channel as he gets Mahela to nick at one outside his off, with the right-hander looking for the glide to third man, but ends up edging instead to Ronchi who is able to complete the take to his right with a dive. Was starting to look settled out there was Mahela, but unfortunately he has to depart from the middle
133 kph, defended from the back foot by Sangakkara
130 kph, plays with an angled face as this is fended away to the off side
129 kph, driven away uppishly square off the wicket as Sangakkara races through the first run to get back for his second
131 kph, manages to get away Mitchell through the leg side with an awkward-looking pull as the ball didn't bounce quite as high as Kumar expected it
130 kph, gets off the mark with a clip off the pads through backward square
full delivery, outside off, which is drilled straight to the deep extra-cover fielder
122 kph, waits on it before cutting this away through to deep extra-cover
124 kph, is late on this sharp bouncer from Mills as Ronchi collects from behind

full delivery which looked to be nipping down leg as Prasanna doesn't get into any sort of position to get this away as he plants his front foot across the line. NZ have requested the review as they are sure they have got his man. Looks like this may have struck in line with leg stump. Prasanna in no position there to play the flick to the leg side. No inside-edge or deviation. Although if was given not out initially, three reds means it will be reversed. Good decision that from NZ as Prasanna is given his marching orders
128 kph, gets a back of a length delivery outside his off stump which he rises to as he glides this down to third man
125 kph, this time tries to run it away past gully, but finds the fielder
123 kph, appeal from Mills as Sangakkara is struck in line, but it looks like this may have initially pitched outside leg as the umpire remains unmoved
opens the face to run this one straight to a waiting gully
129 kph, fullish length going across the right-hander as this is drilled straight at the cover fielder

124 kph, goes after this wide, almost-yorker length from Anderson as he gets a thick outside edge which would have fallen to a traditional third/fourth slip, but with no one in the area, ends up getting away down to third man
135 kph, waits on it before gliding this down to third man
is well late on this length delivery going across him by the left-hander
138 kph, looks to whip away this inswinging delivery on middle and off, but ends up inside-edging onto the pads as the ball is ricocheted to the off side
128 kph, back of a length and glided away towards the slip
124 kph, shuffles over to this off stump before riding the bounce to work this away through the leg side
124 kph, length going across as Sangakkara goes after this, clubbing through the line, but not timing it well, as this just about gets over mid-off to find the long off boundary

125 kph, Chandimal sends his partner back after Sangakkara looked to glide and run, with Guptill picking it up in a flash before firing in a throw at Sanga's end. Chandimal sees the danger and warns his senior, and after Sanga collects himself from the dive back to his end, he rightly thanks his younger ward
126 kph, able to defend this one away to the off side
124 kph, steers this one straight to Gups, but because of the misfield the pair are able to steal the single
123 kph, execute the drop-and-run single to perfection as Sangakkara gets himself to the other end after the leg-side nudge
rushes the right-hander a touch as he fails to flick this away
136 kph, steers this one straight at the short cover fielder as both batsmen decide against the quick run
135 kph, goes down the track before miscuing this slog away through midwicket
124 kph, short of a length outside off which is run down to third man by Sangakkara. This time makes a more concerted effort to go round the bowler as he ran to the other end
129 kph, slips in a yorker outside off which Chandimal gropes at but fails to make a meaningful connection as Ronchi collects the take
125 kph, wide, length delivery outside off which is given the proper treatment as Sangakkara cuts this away fiercely to the third man boundary
109 kph, far too short from Mills as the umpire swivels round to signal the scorer
129 kph, defended on the front foot, and softly, to the off side
128 kph, able to slap away Mills through extra-cover as they complete a couple
124 kph, runs this one outside his off stump through to the fielder at third man. Played late by Sangakkara to get this one away
125 kph, full and straight as this is clipped right to the fielder at midwicket

124 kph, hits through the line as this is swiped away in the general direction of mid-on, who fields the ball before firing in a shy at the non-striker's. Good pressure this from the close-in NZ fielders
not even in the same hemisphere as he looked to connect with this short ball slanting across him

139 kph, and Chandimal's stay comes to a premature end as he chases after this short of a length delivery outside his off stump. Little aimless from the right-hander as he simply looked to stand his ground and bludgeon across the line. Offers an outside edge to Ronchi, who has been peerless today
called one for the over as he bends his back to deliver this sharp bouncer which has the batsman ducking for cover
139 kph, goes straight away after Anderson as he slices away through third man to get off the mark
109 kph, slow, full toss outside his off stump which is redirected through long on by Sangakkara
125 kph, straying down the pads now as this is paddled away behind square on the leg side
128 kph, and almost starts off with a wicket as Perera tries to clobber him through long-off, but doesn't get enough on it as mid-off runs behind to try and take the catch
129 kph, short and Perera sees this like a beach ball as he gets into position to slam this high over cow corner to get a flat six. This is what he was brought out here to do

132 kph, the plan is clear from Perera as he once again attacks this shorter one, this time not as short as the previous one as Perera has to weave out of the path as he finished the pull, getting this more fine to find the deep fine leg fielder on the boundary
134 kph, finesse, this time from Sangakkara's blade, as he glides this length ball outside his off stump to third man

111 kph, width on offer from Southee as this goes across Perera, who is able to get up and under to slice this high over deep backward point, with three fielders in the area converging on it to cut it off before the rope
110 kph, width again from Southee as this time Perera gets him away more towards deep extra-cover
135 kph, fuller one outside his off stump which Perera is late on as he looks to clobber this out of Wellington
136 kph, manages to slice this wide one away over backward point, who despite putting in a dive, is unable to prevent the ball from hitting the rope
108 kph, pick up a couple on the leg side as Perera slams this one off the back foot

139 kph, the Perera experiment comes unstuck as Anderson entices to have another go outside his off, as Perera miscues a slice, this time getting the ball high over third man, with the fielder doing well to dive forward to take the catch
123 kph, manages to steer a single through long off as he moves to 94
118 kph, looks to steer this full delivery outside off past the keeper, but fails to get any connection on it
far too early into the stroke as he looks to pull this back of a length delivery hard through midwicket
129 kph, able to pickup a comfortable single on the leg side to get Kula on strike
130 kph, called one for the over as he delivers a sharp bouncer at Kula, who ducks under it

132 kph, just about having a swing at everything is Kula as NZ go up for an ambitious appeal, probably more to avoid the wide because of the height. But hang on a minute, it looks like they want to review this as they believe there might be a deflection there as there was a noise. Doesn't appear to be any glove or bat on the ball as it went through to the keeper. So no damage done
132 kph, looking for the yorker as he instead offers up a low full toss which is clubbed away to mid-on, who fields the ball and then fires in a throw at the non-striker's, but misses the stumps
134 kph, bangs in the yorker now which is dug out by Sangakkara
118 kph, Kula gets a top-edge to this short ball as he looked to flick it over backward square, with the ball flying high to just get over the rope
139 kph, this time sensibly glides Anderson through third man to pickup the single
134 kph, excellent yorker which follows the batsman as Sangakkara tried to squirt this one away on the off side
137 kph, gets onto one knee as he hammers this full length delivery straight to long off to move to 96
140 kph, dabs this one away outside his off stump through third man as the pair complete a brace
133 kph, short one which Kula is late on as he looks to clear the stadium roof
134 kph, brilliant fielding in the deep by Corey as Sangakkara thought he brought up his hundred with a sumptous cover drive on the up, but Anderson is able to prevent two runs
98 kph, back-of-the-hand slower ball which Sangakkara just about gets away as he moves to 99
short ball on middle which climbs quite high off the deck as Kula is unable to get to it
134 kph, tries to slam through the line but ends up miscuing straight towards mid-off as they scamper the single to bring Kumar on strike

113 kph, brings up his 21st ODI century with a powerful pull shot through midwicket as the ball is sent rocketing to the boundary. Brings up his second hundred of the series as he has been the talisman for SL today with the bat
130 kph, looks to be cute as he shuffles over outside off to try and turn this one fine through the leg side behind square, but does far too much as he misses the ball completely in his attempt
delivers a wide yorker which Kula is late on as he shimmies down the track

139 kph, another yorker on off which is just dug out as the pair run the single, with Anderson running after to collect the ball before firing in a throw at the non-striker's which ends up hitting Kula on his back after bouncing
136 kph, adjusts his stroke at the last possible moment to accommodate for the extra bounce as he miscues this lofted pull towards long on

bangs in a bouncer on middle which Kula tries to get after, but fails to do so. Sangakkara wants the run as he dashes to his end. Ronchi is wise to it though as he picks up the ball before firing an under-handed throw at the striker's end, which he knocks down, but not before Sangakkara had safely made his ground
136 kph, clever batting from Sangakkara as he shuffles to the off side to get the ball leg-side before flicking this over fine leg to get to the boundary rope after a couple of bounces
134 kph, Sangakkara is bringing this innings home for SL as he stands his ground before working with the angle which was heading down leg to manipulate the ball past short backward square
135 kph, goes wide this time outside off as all Sangakkara can do is cart this over to the leg side for a single

inn2.comm: 119 kph, begins with a dream delivery just outside off which nips in as Guptill plants his foot, with the ball curling into the pad. This looked dead as gone as soon as it struck, and the umpire confirmed the decision soon after. What a start for the tourists as NZ are 0 for 1!
124 kph, slipping onto the pads as Kane gets himself away with a clip through midwicket
122 kph, short of a length and angling down the pads as he is a touch late on this as it deviates past him
120 kph, nicely behind the line of this solid ball outside off
122 kph, gets this one to shape away from outside off as Sangakkara collects the take
123 kph, too much swing this time from Kula, and down the leg side, as the umpire signals the scorer
124 kph, gets this one to jag back from a length outside off as Kane is a touch late on it as he brought down the bat
130 kph, begins with a length ball outside off which is allowed through to the keeper
133 kph, squares up Latham as the ball catches the outside edge to fly low to the left of first slip, who fails to grasp it as it runs away for a streaky boundary
133 kph, fuller one which is clipped away off the pads towards backward square by Latham
135 kph, fends away this length ball outside off with an angled face
139 kph, goes after this fuller one outside his off stump as he slices this high over third man to find the fielder just before the rope
fended away off the back foot to the off side to end Eranga's opening over
122 kph, miscues this clip to the leg side as the late swing means Kane hits this uppishly through midwicket, with the short midwicket fielder diving to his right to try and get at the ball
121 kph, a touch wide outside off as this slants across to the keeper
122 kph, fuller one which is steered down to mid-off
gets this one to nibble away off a length outside off as Kane has a waft
122 kph, punched away off the back foot towards the direction of the cover fielders, which dissuades Kane from taking a single
124 kph, on a good line and length outside off as Kane has no choice but to fend it away to the off side
length ball going across the batsman as this one is left well alone
once again left to go through to the keeper by Latham

138 kph, NZ's opening conundrum continues as Latham's middle peg is knocked back after playing down the wrong line to this length ball which straightens, before the left-hander inside-edges onto the timber to make NZ 11 for 2

136 kph, Eranga is putting on a masterclass with the ball at the moment as he gets this one to deviate away upon pitching on a length, with Taylor getting the stride out to meet this before it tailed away dangerously at the last moment
137 kph, this one far too wide of off as the umpire calls wide
135 kph, Taylor gets nicely behind the line of this length ball outside off
134 kph, length outside off which Taylor is unable to reach to
123 kph, bangs in a sharp bouncer which Kane gets under
124 kph, has a play-and-a-miss to this length delivery outside off
123 kph, punched away square off the wicket to pickup a brace
123 kph, short of a length and angling into the batsman's body as this is bunted away
124 kph, short and Kane is onto this in a flash as he rocks back to pull this fiercely through midwicket to find the rope in a hurry
122 kph, sensibly withdraws the bat from this fuller length wide of off
131 kph, plays a lovely, crisp drive on the up as this is drilled straight to the cover fielder

135 kph, Sangakkara looks interested as he goes up instantly for an appeal after Taylor had a flash at this back of a length which rises off the deck. Taylor has a smile, probably knowing what Sangakkara is trying to do. Doesn't seem to be any intent on the part of the Sri Lankans to review this though
delivers this next one down the leg side as Taylor is unable to get any bat on it, with the ball catching the edge of his pad before continuing down to the fine leg boundary
135 kph, moves in line of this length delivery on off, defending it back towards the bowler
137 kph, tries to nurdle this past short midwicket as he leaned forward to clip, but the fielder maintains the pressure on Taylor by not giving any quarter
134 kph, short of a length as he rides the bounce to tuck this softly to the leg side
123 kph, fuller length and nipping in a touch as this is directed away to the leg side
121 kph, driven away on the up through the covers off the back foot as they are able to return for the second
122 kph, gets this one to shape in from a length as it strikes him on the thigh guard
was drawn into playing at this length ball outside off before deciding at the last moment to withdraw the blade
122 kph, worked away off the back foot as he ends up finding the close-in fielder on the leg side
124 kph, length delivery outside off which is slapped hard at Dilshan at point, who is equal to it
137 kph, chops this one away through third man to pickup a single
137 kph, fuller one outside off which is watched through to the keeper
132 kph, able to defend this one on the front foot through the off side
shapes away outside off as Kane follows the line of the ball
140 kph, fires in a quicker one which Kane is late on as he gets away a French cut past Sangakkara
136 kph, doesn't quite time this back foot punch away as it is directed away to the off side
123 kph, length ball shaping into the pads as this is helped down to mid-on
124 kph, meets the ball with an angled face as this is bunted away to the off side
120 kph, driven firmly off the back foot at the short cover fielder
124 kph, fended away off the back foot towards the off side
126 kph, fuller length delivery swinging in on middle. Williamson leans forward and drives it to mid-on
123 kph, drives this one straight to mid-off to end the over
137 kph, gets both feet off the ground as he reaches out to ramp this away through third man
137 kph, slashed away aerially off the back foot as this hovers over the slips before finishing up at third man
136 kph, tries to fend this one off the back foot with a glance, with the ball going up in the air temporarily before landing safe
137 kph, length outside off which curls away as Taylor keeps inside of the line
132 kph, outswinger bowled on a fourth stump channel as Taylor cannot be enticed to flirt with it
136 kph, length ball outside off which Taylor is able to drive away on the up as he picks the gap to find the extra-cover boundary. That will surely help his confidence
drifts in one on middle and leg which is eased away through the leg side
reaches out to defend this one floated in on middle
shimmies down the track to force this one past the short midwicket fielder. Wanted two initially before deciding against the second
looks to get forward before hanging on the back foot to cut this away in front of square
nurdled down to the man at long on for one
defended from the crease to end Prasanna's first over
142 kph, not a bad start, or pace, to begin with by Chameera as he delivers this on a length outside off, as this is cut away just behind square
140 kph, fuller this time, and a touch closer to the batsman, as this is bunted away
142 kph, attacks this length ball outside his off stump, getting away an edge high over the slips to find third man on the bounce
144 kph, touching the 90s now as Taylor is able to cut this away to third man
142 kph, gets nicely on top of the bounce as this is run away through the same region

146 kph, and Chameera has got a dream start to his limited-overs career as he succeeds in getting Taylor to chop one onto the stumps off the bottom edge as he went searching after this slightly fullish length outside off. Taylor has to go after putting up 11. Chameera is over the moon as he celebrates with his team-mates. That was also the fastest ball of the day too!
pushes at this flighted delivery from Prasanna which drifts in to the batsman
this time looking to guide it past short midwicket, but to no avail
goes for the sweep fine down the leg side as Kane is late on it. They go for an appeal, but surely this was going down leg?
gets this one to slide on from outside off as Kane has to get quite low in his stance as he looked to cut this away behind square
reaches out before pushing at this length ball away to the off side
hangs on the back foot before punching it away for a quick single to the off side
146 kph, gets good carry off the deck as this one flies in outside off to the keeper. Chameera looking quite good here
139 kph, tries to guide one past the clutches of Dilshan at point, but he is more than equal to the task as he puts in a wonderful, sprawling effort to cut off the ball
141 kph, gets Elliott to go after this length delivery outside off as he ends up edging it uppishly through where a traditional backward point would have been placed as third man fields the ball
141 kph, punched away off the back foot to the man at deep cover
145 kph, far too full from the bowler as Elliott makes him pay by driving this crisply through long-off to find the boundary. Welcome to international cricket, Chameera
142 kph, and he almost gets Elliott to chop one on as this lands perilously close to the base before continuing on behind square on the leg side

strikes Kane on middle and leg as he is late on the sweep. Looked like it might have been sliding down as the SL fielders consult out in the middle, before opting for the review. Pitches this one on leg before it straightened. Height doesn't seem to be a factor here. No inside-edge of the bat either. Only thing now is whether it strikes the leg stump or not? It will be on-field call for the umpire in terms of the wicket being hit, so it looks like the decision will stand as not out
advances down the track to try and turn this flighted delivery into a full toss before adjusting the shot to work it away quickly to the off side

able to turn one away through deep midwicket as a miscommunication almost spells trouble for the two NZ batsmen, but the fielder in the deep fires in to the wrong end, allowing the offending batsman at the striker's end to get back to his crease
punched away off the back foot to the man at long-off
shimmies down the track before nurdling this down to long-on
looks to run this one past point, but it hits it a lot straighter to him than he would have intended
145 kph, length delivery outside off which is shouldered arms by the batsman
140 kph, short ball which sits up for Kane as he is quickly into position to pull this through midwicket for four
135 kph, fails to slap away this back of a length through the covers, getting it more towards mid-off instead
139 kph, rushes Kane to squirt one away square off the wicket to deep cover
140 kph, another one of the inside-edge which is lucky not to make any contact with the stumps as it continues through towards fine leg
140 kph, fuller one on the pads which is directed to mid-on as drinks is brought onto the field
driven firmly to the short cover fielder
drifting down leg as this is turned away to deep midwicket
advances down before digging this one out towards long off
eased away off the back foot to pickup a single through long on
defended from the crease, and that too with soft hands
shimmies down before adjusting himself to defend this close to the body
127 kph, kicks it off with a length delivery outside off which is turned to the leg side for a quick single
132 kph, in the zone as Kane drives this hard at the short cover fielder, who is able to take most of the pace off it before it is tracked back before the extra-cover boundary
132 kph, gets away Perera through extra-cover off the back foot as they rotate strike
130 kph, is far too early on this length delivery nibbling away a touch outside his off stump
130 kph, scythes away this fullish length uppishly through the covers, with the ball in the air for quite a while, but away from any meddling hands
130 kph, finishes the over with a length delivery on off which is struck back to the bowler
defended from the crease by the batsman
goes down the track before helping this off the pads through square-leg
looks to create room outside off as he cuts this away to extra-cover
tries to force this one away through the off side, but is struggling to get it off the square
driven firmly on the up towards the man at deep cover to pinch the single
tucked away off the pads in the direction of midwicket to end the over

130 kph, sloppy fielding in the deep gives NZ a useful boundary as Chandimal's error at midwicket allows for this pull from Kane to find the boundary, despite the mistake from the fielder to cut it off
129 kph, picks up the single next ball to midwicket
131 kph, shuffles over outside his off stump before clipping this away just behind square
131 kph, pokes out at this length delivery outside off
131 kph, looks to glide this one through third man for a single
128 kph, too full and straight from Perera as this one is driven down to long-on, with the pair running hard enough to complete three before the throw is fired in to the bowler
goes down the track before defending the ball
guides this one just past Prasanna, who puts in a dive to his left to try and grasp the chance, but it was a tough chance
waits on the back foot before punching this away through extra-cover
punched away off the back foot, but close to the bowler in his follow through
played with the softest of hands as this is deflected away by Kane
goes down the leg side as Kane is late on the paddle-sweep through fine leg
once again gets low as he sweeps this competently to deep backward square
fended away to the off side by Elliott
ends up playing down the wrong line as this nibbles away a touch from a length
slips this down the leg side as the umpire signals the scorer
manages to get away Perera down the leg side with a glance off the hips
opens the face to run this one outside off through to the third man region
gets solidly behind the line of this back of a length which tails away outside off
ends the over with a crisp drive on the up through the covers
137 kph, yet another edge away to this length delivery outside off as Elliott runs the single to confirm the 50-run stand between these two
139 kph, cracking shot off the back foot as he looks to blaze this past point, but Dilshan is able to get to it in a flash and cut off a certain boundary
138 kph, short and wide this time from Chameera as Kane slices this away in front of square with a flamboyant back-foot drive
137 kph, pushes at this length delivery outside off, but is unlucky to find the cover fielder
140 kph, simply caresses this off the back foot through extra-cover to pinch the run

140 kph, defended with a nice, straight blade as Chameera gets the rebound before feigning a shy at the striker's stumps, with Kane falling onto his back in an effort to get out of the way of the throw
defended away off the back foot to the off side
127 kph, tries to tuck this one away through the gap on the leg side, but finds the close-in fielder
129 kph, opens the face this time to run this one through the gully region
129 kph, length delivery on middle which is whipped away off the pads in front of square
130 kph, almost a carbon copy of the previous ball, except now the ball is got away a touch squarer to the deep square-leg fielder
125 kph, length on the pads which is dispatched in a hurry to the ropes with a flick of the wrists as he brings up a well-played fifty

139 kph, Chameera picks up another on debut as he gets Elliott to go after this back of a length delivery outside off which is carved high to the fielder at deep cover, who is able to take the catch safely. Elliott's steady knock comes to an end
139 kph, gets good carry off the deck as Anderson is unsure how to defend him as he gets his bat into all kinds of strange positions as the ball whistled through
137 kph, this time onto the pads of Anderson as he glances this fine to deep fine leg for a couple
139 kph, plays just inside the line of this length delivery which tails away a touch outside off
140 kph, on the pads as this is pulled fiercely by Anderson to deep square-leg, who fumbles the initial take because of an unexpected bounce off the outfield
139 kph, too full and on the pads as this is flicked behind to deep fine leg
defended from the crease back to the bowler
gets down the track before nudging this one away to the leg side
waits on the back foot before driving this one back towards the bowler
gets early into his sweep as he looks to get this round the corner
flighted on middle as this is eased down to the long on fielder
rocks onto the back foot before working this away softly to the leg side
138 kph, almost gets Anderson to hole out to short backward square. Looks to be bowling to that plan as he delivers this leg side delivery which is shoveled over to the fielder, but on the bounce

139 kph, Anderson personally greets Chameera as the fast bowler is struck for his first six in international six. Just stood his ground before bludgeoning through the line of this length ball to send this sailing high over the midwicket fence
137 kph, looked like he was going to send this one to the moon, but is far too early into the stroke as he went for the pull, with the ball inside-edging onto his pads
126 kph, able to dig out this yorker just outside off to squirt it away through third man
132 kph, short of a length outside off which is pulled in the general vicinity of deep midwicket

135 kph, sends this length ball high over deep backward square as there was a moment when the fielders thought it would come down on the ground, before it dawned on everyone that it was Anderson who had sent this beauty away

and NZ suffer a huge blow as Kane, who was looking to get down the track to Dilshan, ends up adjusting his shot to try and sweep it behind, with the ball catching the top-edge before spooning over to Mahela at short backward square, who is able to take the catch with a dive forward. Ends a spirited knock from the young right-hander. This could be the vital breakthrough the visitors were looking for in this match
manages to get one away down the leg side
Anderson shows off his brute strength as he cuts this fiercely off the back foot through extra-cover, beating a chasing boundary rider from deep cover to the rope
tucked away off the pads towards square-leg
eases away a single through extra-cover to rotate the strike
on the back foot as this is worked down to long on to end a successful over for SL
138 kph, length just outside off which is driven on the up past Chameera to the long-off boundary, but is tracked back by the fielder who puts in the dive before the rope
137 kph, glances away this length delivery on the pads as Anderson runs the first one hard enough to come back for the second in time
140 kph, drills this fuller one straight to the man at mid-off as Anderson continues to search for the boundary
slips in a good length delivery outside off which Anderson plays inside of as it carries through to Sangakkara

137 kph, length delivery going across which is hammered by Anderson through extra-cover as it flies by at catchcable height past a diving silly mid-off, who is unable to get anywhere near it as it rockets away to the rope
137 kph, full length delivery outside off which is lasered straight to the silly mid-off fielder, who collapses on it in time

strikes Ronchi in line with the stumps as Dilshan looks certain that he has got his man, but the umpire is unfazed. After some thought though, it looks like they won't pursue it. Was going down leg anyway when it struck
steered away to the off side now by the batsman
onto the back foot and eased away to mid-on
goes round the wicket to Corey now, drifting one outside off which is punched off the back foot to long-off
looks to plant his foot and force this past the mid-off fielder, but no dice
able to get away a paddle through midwicket as Ronchi retains the strike
133 kph, fuller length delivery outside off which is struck to the mid-off fielder
137 kph, gets forward to deflect this one on the off side as they scramble the quick single

133 kph, Eranga strikes! Anderson has to go! Ends up offering a feather of an edge to Sangakkara as this back of a length nips away at the last moment, catching the edge of Anderson's bat before Sangakkara takes the chance low to his left
134 kph, gets this one to curl in a touch outside off as Vettori shoulders arms
133 kph, content to let this back of a length fly through to the keeper
134 kph, gets nicely behind the line of the ball to end a successful over for Sri Lanka
waits on the back foot before defending to the bowler
offers up a full toss which is swat by Ronchi baseball-style straight down the ground for six
this time elects to drive it back to the bowler as he crouched forward
waits on it before easing this down to long on
going round the wicket to Vettori now as he flights one outside off which Vettori edges away just behind square on the off side to get off the mark
driven straight back to the bowler as Dilshan puts in the dive to cut it off
132 kph, fuller one which is driven through the off side by the batsman
133 kph, opens the face a touch to try and get this past point, but to no avail
135 kph, meets this length ball straying down the pads with the full face as mid-on fields the ball
137 kph, tries to get this length delivery past the close-in fielder on the leg side, but finds him straightaway

132 kph, Ronchi aware of no fielders in the deep at cow corner as he chips Eranga high over mid-on, with this one looking like it would spell his demise before it landed with a couple of bounces just before the rope. The fielder is able to use some fancy footwork to cut this off before the rope
130 kph, this time struck straight to the mid-off fielder
tries to get under this tossed up delivery outside off, but doesn't quite it middle it as the ball is hit towards the covers
reaches out to this flighted delivery on middle and off before steering it away through midwicket
able to carve this away off the back foot through the gap at backward point for a couple
tossed up and meted the proper punishment by Ronchi as he picks his spot straight back past the bowler to lift him for a one-bounce four
looks to attack this leg-side delivery with a sweep down fine leg, but doesn't quite it get away
Ronchi able to get to the other end thanks to a miscued sweep
tries to force one away through long-off as they end up settling for the single
attempts to get Prasanna away through midwicket, which he ends up doing successfully
turns this into a full toss which is slammed straight to short midwicket
a bit short from Prasanna as Ronchi backs away before hitting this straight back
once again gives it flight as Ronchi drills this straight to the man at long off
looking to use his feet to make this a full toss which he wanted to cart through midwicket, but instead gets a leading edge which flies over to the off side
119 kph, gets to the other end with a push to this length delivery outside off as the ball targets the mid-off fielder
121 kph, flicked away off the pads as he sees backward square inside the ring. Safe shot as this one finds the boundary
bowls a fuller length across Vettori which he is late on as he attempts to follow the line
slightly fuller and on middle and leg, Vettori works it to deep mid-wicket for a single
123 kph, Ronchi quickly onto the back foot to this slightly short of a length from Kula, offering a chance to the short midwicket fielder, but this one dies on him before it reaches him
124 kph, makes Kula pay next ball with a lofted shot down the ground to this fuller length delivery
136 kph, opens the face to run this one outside off down to third man
136 kph, rides on top of this short of a length outside off as this is fended away to the off side
134 kph, full length delivery which is eased down by Ronchi to long on
114 kph, leg-side delivery which is punished as Vettori shuffles over to the off side to flick this through deep fine leg as this races away to the rope
132 kph, tries to get this one off the square past point, but fails to do so
136 kph, Vettori is producing some useful boundaries here as he is able to glance this away just behind square, getting enough on it to find the rope despite the chase in the deep
fires in a yorker which is just dug out by Ronchi
116 kph, waits on this slower ball before slamming it straight to the long off fielder
120 kph, attempts a wide yorker which is more wide than anything else
tries to get away this fuller delivery just outside off, but is unable to get any significant bat on it
119 kph, low, full toss wide of off which is blitzed away along the carpet to deep cover
121 kph, slips one down the leg side as Ronchi is looking for the big heave through midwicket
Ronchi misses out on this fuller one as it ends up glancing the pads towards fine leg
102 kph, full, slower delivery outside off which Ronchi is able to dispatch quickly to the leg side as they run the first one hard in order to complete two

131 kph, and Vettori welcomes him back with a Calypso flick to this short of a length on middle which just races away to the boundary, despite the best intention of the boundary rider at deep fine leg
134 kph, shifts over a touch to his off stump now as he looks to laser one through the covers, but finds the fielder
140 kph, in the zone as Vettori caresses a lovely drive on the up which quickens across the outfield to find the rope. Intensity at the ground is starting to ramp up as NZ edge closer
136 kph, fullish length outside off which is squirted away to the man at deep cover
137 kph, fires in the yorker which follows Ronchi as he ends up inside-edging behind to deep fine leg
131 kph, picks his spot on the leg side before proceeding to heave Chameera over cow corner to find the rope. Ends a wonderful over for NZ as they look to wind down this chase further
127 kph, fullish length on the pads which is clipped away to deep midwicket
gets good shape from outside off to this fuller one going across Vettori
125 kph, looking to get at the blockhole as this is just about dug out fine towards short backward square, with the batsman able to run the bye
114 kph, sees this slower ball early before crouching low to blast this high over cow corner for six. Ronchi has paced his innings superbly so far

126 kph, fortune favouring the brave here in Wellington as Ronchi, looking to carve high over point, ends up miscuing this back over third man, but this lands safely with no fielders in the deep over there

126 kph, and Kula has the last word as he bowls the perfect yorker right at the base of middle which Ronchi, who was looking to get up and under down the ground, is unable to dig out. Was a beauty of an inswinging yorker as Kula leapt high in the air in celebration, with Ronchi not looking amused at all. Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans
131 kph, opens the face as he directs this behind square on the off side
132 kph, able to squirt away this length ball through third man
130 kph, onto the front foot as this is steered away behind square on the off side
131 kph, content to just glide this length delivery outside off to the fielder at third man
128 kph, fended away to the off side as point comes into play
131 kph, ends with a lovely back of a length outside off which nibbles away upon pitching
full from the spinner as Vettori is late on the sweep, getting an inside-edge onto the pad

excellent flighted delivery from Prasanna which dupes Vettori as he played down the wrong line, with the ball going through the legs to find the stumps behind. The Sri Lankans have a few parting words for Vettori as he goes, with NZ sliding to 218 for 8 now
flighted on middle and off as this is defended back to the bowler
able to steer this one past the bowler through extra-cover
strikes the front pad of the batsman, but going down leg, as this rolls away to the leg side
able to squirt away this fuller one tossed up on off, but straight to the cover fielder
132 kph, full delivery going across Southee as this is driven on the full to long off
133 kph, full and on middle as this is drilled straight to the boundary rider at deep extra-cover
131 kph, goes over the wicket now as this time Mills is able to blast away off the back foot to deep cover

130 kph, and the ninth wicket falls as Southee perishes with a miscued, top-edge which flies high over to Sangakkara as he went for the pull, but the bat rotated in his hands to offer up this straightforward chance. NZ now staring down the barrel as SL look to wrap it up here in Wellington
131 kph, Mills getting in some batting practice before the World Cup as he waits on this short ball about chest height before dispatching it about 30 rows back over fine leg
132 kph, gives up a loose delivery which just sits up for Mills outside his off stump as he carves this away ferociously to find the extra-cover rope
able to fend away this delivery arriving on leg, as the ball is hit away to the off side
gets forward before striking this firmly at mid-off
able to ease one away through long on as they complete a single
able to successfully dig out this flighted one on middle
guided down to the fielder at long off as they are able to complete a brace
worked away off the back foot down to long on to finish the over
120 kph, looking to land another yorker but gets it wrong as Mills just bludgeons this full toss over long-off, but not well enough to beat the boundary rider on the rope
123 kph, fuller one which is chipped over long off by Mills as he is able to come back for two once more
125 kph, looks like he may have just slammed this straight down long off's throat, but gets this more straighter to find the boundary
125 kph, close to getting it into the blockhole as Mills mistimes this drive down to long on
124 kph, ends up striking this back of a length back at the bowler, who is able to cut it off after misfielding initally
122 kph, all welcome boundaries here as McClenaghan gets away a chop-on past the keeper to get four through the fine leg region
drifts one in from outside off which is steered away through deep midwicket

gets down the track before the spin away from him means he is forced to edge it away behind square. The gully sees this quickly as he runs across to pickup and fire in a throw as Sangakkara is able to remove the stump before the batsman made the striker's end
